name: CD4+ T Cell
description: Helper T cells that coordinate immune responses by stimulating other immune cells

name: CD8+ T Cell
description: Cytotoxic T cells that directly kill infected or abnormal cells

name: Natural Killer Cell
description: Natural Killer cells that provide rapid responses against viruses and tumors

name: Innate Lymphoid Cell Type 1
description: Innate Lymphoid Cells that mirror Th1 functions by producing interferon-gamma against intracellular pathogens

name: Innate Lymphoid Cell Type 2
description: Innate Lymphoid Cells that help with parasite defense and tissue repair

name: Innate Lymphoid Cell Type 3
description: Innate Lymphoid Cells that support barrier immunity and tissue homeostasis

name: T Regulatory Cell
description: Regulatory T cells that suppress immune responses to maintain tolerance and prevent autoimmunity

name: T Follicular Helper Cell
description: T Follicular Helper cells that assist B cells in antibody production

name: T Helper 1 Cell
description: T helper cells specialized in fighting intracellular pathogens

name: T Helper 2 Cell
description: T helper cells that combat parasites and mediate allergic responses

name: T Helper 17 Cell
description: T helper cells that protect against extracellular bacteria and fungi

name: T Helper 22 Cell
description: T helper cells that support skin immunity

name: T Helper 9 Cell
description: T helper cells that contribute to mucosal immunity and inflammation

name: Mucoasl-Associated Invariant T Cell
description: Mucosal-Associated Invariant T cells that guard mucosal surfaces against microbial threats

name: Antigen Presenting Cell
description: Antigen Presenting Cells that capture and present antigens to T cells to initiate adaptive immune responses
